org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Class ServerEndpointUDP

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ServerEndpoint
      org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ServerEndpointUDP

 class ServerEndpointUDP
extends ServerEndpoint

Wrapper that adds TCP like client handling to the UDP DatagramSocket.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema
See Also:
ServerEndpointUDP(java.net.DatagramSocket), getClientEndpoint(), ServerEndpointUDP.DatagramPacketReceiver

Nested Class Summary
private  class ServerEndpointUDP.DatagramPacketReceiver
          Receives DatagramPacket objects and delegates these to an ClientEndpoint to emulate TCP Socket behavior where a Socket per client receives messages from a connected client.
 
Field Summary
private  DatagramSocket datagramSocket
          The server socket we're accepting client messages on in the form of UDP datagram packets.
private  Map<SocketAddress,ClientEndpointUDP> knownClients
          The list of known clients, based on the SocketAddress of previously received DatagramPacket objects.
private  List<ClientEndpointUDP> newClients
          The list of new clients ready to be returned when asked for a new client endpoint.
private static int PACKET_BUFFER_SIZE
          This should probably be tuned at some point to allow for larger datagram packets.

Constructor Detail

ServerEndpointUDP

public ServerEndpointUDP(DatagramSocket datagramSocket)
Constructor; starts a new Thread listening for new datagram packets. If a new client sends a message, it will be returned on getClientEndpoint(). In either case the datagram is passed on to the client endpoint being enqueued.

Parameters:
datagramSocket - A DatagramSocket to listen to UDP messages.
Method Detail

getClientEndpoint

ClientEndpoint getClientEndpoint()
Returns a new client endpoint in case a datagram packet is received from an unknown client. Otherwise, nothing is returning and this method remains blocking (like ServerSocket.accept()) until a new client sends a datagram packet.

TCP messages received are inherently coupled to a (client) Socket. To mimic this behavior ServerEndpointUDP keeps track of known clients (by having received datapackets from them before) and when receiving new datagram packets, we'll try to match the sender address to a known client. Once matched, we let the associated client endpoint deal with the datagram packet, as a TCP Socket would have done. If the datagram packet could not be matched to a known client, a new client is trying to communicate with us, and so we can return a new ClientEndpoint.

Specified by:
getClientEndpoint in class ServerEndpoint
Returns:
An endpoint that acts similarly for TCP and UDP clients.

removeClient

public void removeClient(SocketAddress clientSocketAddress)
Removes a client from the list of known clients. Most likely because it was explicitly closed by calling ClientEndpointUDP.close().

Parameters:
clientSocketAddress - The socket address which identifies the ClientEndpointUDP to be removed.

hasClient

public boolean hasClient(SocketAddress clientSocketAddress)
Returns whether a client is known to this (UDP) server endpoint.

Parameters:
clientSocketAddress - The address by which the client is identified.
Returns:
Whether knownClients contains the given socket address.
